greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of lattice paths from {n}^k to {0}^k using steps that decrement one component or all components by the same positive integer; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..20, flattened
maple: b:= proc(l) option remember; local m; m:= nops(l);
seq(seq(A(n, d-n), n=0..d), d=0..10);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 24 2013
mathematica: b[l_] := b[l] = With[{m = Length[l]}, If[m == 0 || l[[m]] == 0, 1, If[m > 1, Sum[b[l - Array[j&, m]], {j, 1, l[[1]]}],  0] + Sum[Sum[b[Sort[ReplacePart[l, i -> l[[i]] - j]]], {j, 1, l[[i]]}], {i, 1, m}]]]; a[n_, k_] := b[Array[n&, k]]; Table[Table[a[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 16 2013, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 24 2013
